channel.title: Port forwarding trouble?
channel.description: Hi, I just port-forworeded with a AirPort Extreme router to 43594 on my windows 7 computer. I used No-Ip to add a host. I used my servers client with my ip and 43594 as the port and it doesn't work. I used the IP (0.0.0.0) and the port (43594) and it worked perfect. Why doesn't my IP work??

item.title: Port forwarding trouble?
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

If you are hosting it on your computer, you must use localhost as the ip and other people must use your ip or no-ip. As sk8rdude said, run your server first, then check on canyouseeme.org.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding trouble?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

No shit sherlock holmes.
I said turn the server on and check if canyouseeme.org will see the port.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding trouble?
item.dc:creator: @codex2009 codex2009
item.description:
@codex2009 wrote:

The port (43594) is the general port for RSPS though, it can’t be the port as I can use it without my IP I set for my server. And my server was up but it won’t allow me to connect to it with my (.no-ip.biz), but it lets me with my (0.0.0.0)) running off the port (which seems to be working fine) just the IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding trouble?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Turn the server on, and use canyouseeme.org to see if the port is open.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding trouble?

item.description:

Hi, I just port-forworeded with a AirPort Extreme router to 43594 on my windows 7 computer. I used No-Ip to add a host. I used my servers client with my ip and 43594 as the port and it doesn’t work. I used the IP (0.0.0.0) and the port (43594) and it worked perfect. Why doesn’t my IP work??
